intro: Ageratum mexicanum album, commonly known as white ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its fluffy, white or pale blue flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardeners. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to attract pollinators like butterflies and bees.
